item.title: UK officially in recession for first time in 11 years
item.description: The UK has officially fallen into recession after suffering its biggest slump on record between April and June.

item.title: Replacement A-level grades 'no lower than mock exams'
item.description: Last-minute changes have been made to the way A-level and GCSE results in England are to be decided.

item.title: Coronavirus: Cases surge as France goes 'wrong way'
item.description: The prime minister warned the French public it must take serious action to control a surge in cases.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK in recession and A-levels 'triple lock'
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this Wednesday morning.

item.title: New dinosaur related to T. rex discovered on Isle of Wight
item.description: Four bones found at Shanklin belonged to a new species of theropod dinosaur, a study finds.

item.title: Coronavirus: Airline refunds ‘still too slow’ despite warning
item.description: Which? says the Civil Aviation Authority needs more powers to punish airlines over refund delays.

item.title: Thunderstorms bring flooding and disruption
item.description: Some schools will not reopen after overnight thunderstorms caused flooding and problems for the road and rail network.

item.title: Coronavirus spread fear of Sheffield carer who went untested
item.description: Alison Taylor fears she may have been unwittingly responsible for spreading Covid-19 to care homes.

item.title: Coronavirus: Severe mental health problems rise amid pandemic
item.description: An NHS Confederation report predicts a 20% increase in demand for services in the coming months.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'New Zealand will get rid of the virus again'
item.description: The epidemiologist behind the country's elimination strategy says you have to plan for setbacks.

item.title: Dwayne 'the Rock' Johnson is highest-earning male actor
item.description: This is the second year in a row that the wrestler-turned-actor has been declared the top earner.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is a recession?
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has thrown many countries into recession - but what exactly is it and how could it affect you?

item.title: The Papers: 'Pick your grades' and Stephen Lawrence probe ends
item.description: Many of Wednesday's papers report on concerns as students in England get A-level grades on Thursday.

item.title: Tiger sightings increase in Thai forest
item.description: This year 79 tigers were captured on hidden cameras in Thailand’s Thungyai-Huai Kha Khaeng forest.

item.title: Skater girls: Gender, joy and slow photography
item.description: A nearly 170-year-old process has been used to photograph female and non-binary skateboarders.

item.title: How Ebola prepared one doctor for Covid-19
item.description: How Ebola prepared one doctor in the Democratic Republic of Congo to treat coronavirus.

item.title: Trowels in lay-bys for 'urgent toilet breaks'
item.description: A Highlands community council says the temporary quick solution is needed to tackle outdoor toileting.

item.title: Medical dream student 'over the moon' with grades U-turn
item.description: Olivia Biggart says she is "over the moon" she will now get the five As she needs to apply to medical school.

item.title: In pictures: Spectacular storms light up England skies
item.description: Overnight thunderstorms lit up the skies around England and more are forecast this week.

item.title: Coronavirus: Does your mask need an upgrade?
item.description: Designer Anne Sophie Cochevelou decorates her face coverings with anything from Barbies to Pokemon toys.

item.title: Coronavirus: How ghost cruise ships became a summer tourist attraction
item.description: On the south coast, people have started going on sightseeing cruises of, well, cruise ships.

item.title: BBC Women's Sport Survey: Periods, the pill and the effect on female athletes
item.description: Female athletes discuss how periods, contraceptive pills and the coil can impact their performance in unexpected ways.

item.title: Coronavirus: Exam results day rituals put on hold
item.description: The struggle to balance social distancing with the emotional need to celebrate and commiserate.

item.title: 'Loyalty is really important to us' - Biffy Clyro on the fall-out behind their new album
item.description: "Loyalty is really important to us," say the band, after being let down by their "inner circle".

item.title: Coronavirus: France's champagne industry goes flat amid pandemic
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has led to plummeting demand - leaving growers and producers at loggerheads.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can California's economy survive the latest surge?
item.description: The US state has had to reverse its reopening plans amid a surge in cases.

item.title: Unemployment rate: How many people are out of work?
item.description: The number of people claiming benefits has surged, but the unemployment rate has barely moved. Why?

item.title: 'This is a crucial moment for young black people'
item.description: Tracey Gore takes on her new role as chairwoman of the Race Equality Taskforce in Liverpool.

item.title: 'A Hinge date saved my life' and other cancer dating stories
item.description: Dating during lockdown is hard enough in 2020, but how do you deal with it when cancer is in the mix too?

item.title: Sevilla beat Wolves to book Europa League semi-final with Man Utd
item.description: Wolves' Europa League dream comes to a heartbreaking end as Sevilla book a semi-final against Manchester United.

item.title: O'Sullivan fights back to beat Williams and set up semi-final with Selby
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan says his performance "was embarrassing" as he reached the World Championship semi-finals with a 13-10 win over Mark Williams.

item.title: Gascoigne's antics, Maldini's brilliance & a career low - Di Matteo looks back
item.description: Chelsea legend Roberto di Matteo tells the MOTD Top 10 podcast about the moments that shaped his playing career.

item.title: Goode signs new Saracens deal but will play in Japan next season
item.description: Full-back Alex Goode extends his Saracens contract until 2023, but will spend next season on loan at Japanese side NEC Green Rockets.

item.title: London 2012: Glory for Joshua plus Bryant helps USA to 14th gold - relive day 16
item.description: Relive the best action from day 16 of London 2012 as Anthony Joshua made it three boxing golds for Britain with a dramatic win over Roberto Cammarelle in the super-heavyweight final.

item.title: Champions League: How Atalanta took Europe by storm before facing PSG
item.description: As they prepare to take on PSG in the Champions League, BBC Sport finds out how Atalanta have become a force in Italy and on the continent.

item.title: Coronavirus: How could a recession affect me?
item.description: The UK is in recession for the first time in 11 years, but what does that mean?

item.title: Coronavirus: Where do governments borrow money?
item.description: How does it work when a government wants to borrow money, and when does it have to pay it back?

item.title: What is redundancy, who can be made redundant and what are my rights?
item.description: As thousands of job losses owing to coronavirus are announced, here is a guide to your financial entitlements.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does Covid-19 test-and-trace work?
item.description: People who have been in close contact with someone found to have Covid-19 are now being traced.

item.title: How will I get my A-level, GCSE or BTEC exam results this year?
item.description: Exams in the UK were cancelled this year, but how are students learning their results?

item.title: Coronavirus: Will schools fully reopen for the new term?
item.description: Schools are set to go back for the autumn term, but scientists say society may have to make trade-offs.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: Belgium, Bahamas and Andorra are the latest places from where people must quarantine on arriving in the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: How can I use the 'eat out to help out scheme'?
item.description: Thousands of venues are taking part in a discounting scheme to help boost the hospitality industry.

item.title: Coronavirus: What happens when the furlough scheme ends?
item.description: Almost 10 million people have accessed the scheme, which closes in October.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key charts and maps explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is a second wave and is one coming?
item.description: What are second waves and how big a problem are they?

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: A new continuous cough and fever are also symptom,s but how do you know what to look for?

item.title: When does the stamp duty holiday end?
item.description: The government has announced changes to stamp duty to help cut costs for anyone buying a home.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the risks of opening schools?
item.description: Children seem to be at low risk from the disease, but can they still spread it?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK's travel rules and which countries can you visit?
item.description: New rules mean people entering the UK from certain countries will not have to quarantine.

item.title: Europe lockdown: New coronavirus rules country by country
item.description: What are European countries doing to control new coronavirus outbreaks?

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus immunity: Can you catch it twice?
item.description: Immunity is the crucial question and understanding it will tell us how the pandemic will end.

item.title: Coronavirus: What am I allowed to do in the hot weather this weekend?
item.description: Hot weather is expected across the UK this weekend, but how do you stay within the rules?

item.title: Coronavirus: Where can I now go on holiday in the UK?
item.description: Where can I go and what can do on a holiday in the UK?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new lockdown rules for Preston and other areas?
item.description: Preston has become the latest place to impose restrictions. But how does a local lockdown work?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Social distancing and lockdown rules are changing in England - but what can you now do?

item.title: Coronavirus: Can I get travel insurance and what are my travel rights?
item.description: As quarantine rules are relaxed, holidays are back on the agenda

item.title: Coronavirus: How to stay cool in a face mask as hot UK weather forecast
item.description: Temperatures are forecast to top 30C in some parts of the UK this weekend. Perhaps it is not the time you want to be partially covering your face.
